intro: Varthemia kotschyi, commonly known as the Persian sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and small, spiny fruits that contain seeds. The plant thrives in sandy and rocky soils, demonstrating high drought tolerance. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Varthemia kotschyi is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
